definitions: foot of an animal with claws or nails
informal term for a person's hand, especially when large or clumsy
examples: The cat's paw left muddy prints across the floor
The bear's massive paw could crush a watermelon easily
Keep your dirty paws off my new laptop computer
His enormous paws made the teacup look ridiculously small

definitions: smallest and most numerous piece in chess that moves forward
item left as security for a loan at a pawnshop
person used or manipulated by others for their purposes
examples: She moved her pawn forward two squares to begin
He sacrificed his pawn to protect the queen strategically
He left his guitar as pawn for the emergency loan
The family heirloom served as pawn until payday arrived
The spy was merely a pawn in international politics
Don't be a pawn in their corporate power games

definitions: business that offers secured loans to people using personal property as collateral
examples: The pawnshop window displayed guitars, jewelry, and electronics for sale
She visited three pawnshops looking for vintage musical instruments

definitions: money received for work or services rendered over time
act or instance of paying wages or salary to employees
examples: The pay at this company exceeds industry standards significantly
Her monthly pay covers all living expenses and savings
Friday is pay day for all hourly employees here
The accounting department processes pay twice each month

definitions: amount of money that is owed and must be paid
examples: Accounts payable increased significantly during the fourth quarter period
The invoice shows payables due within thirty days

definitions: profit or advantage gained from an investment or action over time
act of revenge or retaliation for a wrong previously suffered
examples: The payback period for solar panels is typically five years
We calculated the payback on our marketing investment carefully
This prank is payback for what you did last week
He sought payback for years of workplace humiliation endured

definitions: check or document showing wages earned and deductions for a pay period
examples: Her paycheck arrives via direct deposit every two weeks
The paycheck stub showed all taxes and benefits deducted

definitions: day on which salary or wages are regularly paid to employees
examples: Payday falls on the last Friday of each month
Everyone goes shopping right after payday comes around

definitions: person or organization that makes a payment to another party
examples: The insurance payer refused to cover the medical procedure
Tax payers fund all government services and infrastructure projects

definitions: carrying capacity of an aircraft or launch vehicle excluding operational equipment
explosive or destructive material carried by a missile or bomb
actual data or message content in a data transmission packet
examples: The rocket's payload included three commercial satellites for orbit
The shuttle can carry a payload of 65,000 pounds maximum
The missile's payload was a conventional explosive warhead device
Military drones can deliver various payload types to targets
The network packet's payload contained encrypted user data
Hackers inserted malicious code into the payload section

definitions: official who is responsible for paying wages or salaries to employees
person or organization that provides funding and expects compliance in return
examples: The paymaster distributed wages every Friday afternoon to workers
The military paymaster ensured all soldiers received proper compensation
Foreign governments acted as paymasters for the rebel groups
Corporate paymasters demanded changes to the research conclusions

definitions: act of paying money that is owed for goods or services
amount of money paid regularly at specified intervals for something
examples: Payment must be received within thirty days of invoice
We accept payment by cash, check, or credit card
The monthly payment on the loan is eight hundred dollars
She missed two payments and received a warning notice

definitions: final payment of a debt or mortgage that completes the obligation
benefit or profit received as a result of an action or investment
payment made to someone to ensure cooperation or silence about wrongdoing
examples: The mortgage payoff amount includes principal and accrued interest
They celebrated the payoff of their thirty-year home loan
The payoff for studying hard was acceptance to medical school
Years of research finally had a payoff in breakthrough discovery
The official received a payoff to approve the illegal permit
Police discovered evidence of payoffs to various city inspectors

definitions: list of employees who receive regular pay from a company
total amount of wages paid by a company to its employees
examples: The company has over five thousand people on its payroll
New employees are added to payroll after orientation completion
Monthly payroll expenses exceed two million dollars for operations
The accounting department processes payroll every two weeks

definitions: abbreviated form of percent, representing a proportion out of one hundred
examples: Sales increased by 15 pct over the previous quarter
The survey showed 68 pct voter approval rating overall

definitions: small spherical green seed or pod eaten as a vegetable
examples: She added fresh peas to the spring vegetable soup
The garden peas were sweet and tender this year

definitions: state or period of freedom from war or violence between groups
state of mental or emotional calm without anxiety or disturbance
examples: The treaty brought peace after five years of warfare
World peace remains an elusive goal for many nations
She found peace through daily meditation and yoga practice
The countryside offers peace away from city noise

definitions: military personnel deployed to maintain peace between hostile groups or nations
examples: UN peacekeepers patrol the border between the conflicting nations
The peacekeepers helped distribute humanitarian aid to refugees

definitions: activity of maintaining peace through military or diplomatic intervention in conflict areas
examples: The peacekeeping mission lasted for over two years successfully
International peacekeeping efforts prevented the conflict from escalating further

definitions: person who brings about peace or reconciliation between disputing parties
examples: She acted as peacemaker between the feuding family members
The diplomat was renowned as an international peacemaker

definitions: period when a nation is not engaged in war with another nation
examples: Military spending typically decreases during peacetime periods significantly
The economy flourished during the long peacetime era

definitions: soft round fruit with fuzzy skin and sweet juicy flesh
pale pinkish-orange color resembling the fruit's flesh
examples: The ripe peach dripped juice when she bit into it
Georgia is famous for growing delicious peaches every summer
She painted the nursery walls a soft peach color
The bridesmaids wore dresses in various peach shades

definitions: large bird with brilliant blue and green plumage and eye-spotted tail feathers
person who displays themselves in a vain or ostentatious manner
examples: The peacock spread his magnificent tail feathers in display
Peacocks roamed freely through the palace gardens
He strutted around like a peacock in his new suit
Don't be such a peacock about your promotion

definitions: large Asian pheasant of which the male is the peacock with ornamental plumage
examples: The zoo's peafowl population includes both Indian and green varieties
Peafowl are native to tropical forests of Asia

definitions: pointed top of a mountain or hill reaching upward
point of highest activity, quality, or achievement in something
projecting brim at the front of a cap for shade
examples: Climbers reached the peak after eight hours of ascent
Snow covered the mountain peaks throughout the summer months
Sales reached their peak during the holiday shopping season
The athlete was at the peak of her career
He adjusted the peak of his baseball cap downward
The peak shaded his eyes from the bright sunlight

definitions: loud ringing of bells, especially in sequence or celebration
loud sound or succession of sounds like thunder or laughter
examples: The church bells rang out in joyful peals at midnight
A peal of bells announced the royal wedding ceremony
Peals of thunder shook the house during the storm
Her peals of laughter filled the entire room

definitions: oval seed that grows underground in pods, commonly eaten as snack
very small or insignificant amount of something, especially money
examples: She's allergic to peanuts and all tree nuts
Roasted peanuts are a popular snack at baseball games
They're paying peanuts for such demanding work responsibilities
The repair cost peanuts compared to buying new

definitions: sweet yellowish or greenish fruit that tapers toward the stem
examples: The pear was perfectly ripe and juicy inside
She made pear tart for the dinner party

definitions: hard lustrous sphere formed within oyster shells, valued as a gem
person or thing of great rarity, value, or beauty
examples: The necklace featured a string of cultured pearls
Divers search for natural pearls in tropical waters
She's a pearl among assistants - absolutely invaluable
His advice was pearls of wisdom from experience

definitions: gates of heaven in Christian tradition, made of or resembling pearl
examples: Saint Peter supposedly guards the pearly gates of heaven
She joked about meeting him at the pearly gates

definitions: poor farmer or farm laborer of low social status in historical times
person of low social status or crude manners in modern usage
examples: Medieval peasants worked the lord's land for protection
The peasants revolted against oppressive taxation and servitude
He dismissed them as peasants unworthy of his attention
Don't act like a peasant at the formal dinner

definitions: class of peasants collectively in a country or region
examples: The peasantry comprised most of the medieval population
Revolutionary ideas spread quickly among the oppressed peasantry

definitions: partially decomposed organic matter formed in wetlands, used as fuel or soil amendment
examples: Irish farmers traditionally burned peat for winter heating
The garden center sells peat moss for soil improvement

definitions: small smooth rounded stone worn by water or sand action
examples: Children skipped pebbles across the calm lake surface
The beach was covered with colorful pebbles and shells

definitions: edible oval nut from a species of hickory tree native to North America
examples: Pecan pie is a traditional Southern dessert specialty
The orchard produces thousands of pounds of pecans annually

definitions: quick light kiss usually on the cheek or lips
unit of dry volume equal to quarter of a bushel
examples: She gave him a peck on the cheek goodbye
Their first kiss was just a nervous peck
Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers
A peck of apples weighs about ten pounds

definitions: polysaccharide substance in fruit that forms gel when heated with sugar and acid
examples: Apples contain high levels of natural pectin for jellies
Commercial pectin helps jams set properly when cooking

definitions: large chest muscle connecting the chest wall to the upper arm
examples: Bench presses primarily work the pectoral muscles effectively
He strained his left pectoral during weight training

definitions: distinctive or characteristic feature that makes something unique or special
strange or unusual feature or habit that seems odd to others
examples: The peculiarity of this species is its nocturnal flowering
Each region has its own linguistic peculiarities and dialects
His peculiarity of counting steps everywhere annoyed his friends
The house had several architectural peculiarities from previous renovations

definitions: teacher, especially one who is pedantic, formal, or overly concerned with rules
examples: The old pedagogue insisted on perfect Latin pronunciation daily
He was a pedagogue who valued discipline over creativity

definitions: method and practice of teaching, especially as an academic subject or concept
examples: Modern pedagogy emphasizes interactive learning over passive lectures
She studied pedagogy before becoming a high school teacher

definitions: lever operated by foot to control a machine or vehicle
foot-operated device on musical instruments to modify sound
examples: Press the brake pedal gently to slow down smoothly
The bicycle pedals were rusty from years of neglect
The sustain pedal on the piano creates a resonant effect
Guitar effects pedals can dramatically alter the instrument's sound

definitions: person who goes from place to place selling small goods
person who sells illegal drugs or promotes harmful ideas
examples: The peddler sold trinkets from his cart downtown
Street peddlers offered souvenirs to passing tourists eagerly
Police arrested several drug peddlers near the school
He's a peddler of conspiracy theories and misinformation

definitions: activity of going from place to place selling goods
illegal activity of selling drugs or spreading harmful ideas
examples: He made a living peddling household goods door-to-door
Peddling without a license is illegal in this city
They were charged with peddling narcotics to minors
Stop peddling those ridiculous conspiracy theories to people

definitions: base or platform on which a statue, column, or structure rests
position of uncritical respect or admiration for someone
examples: The marble statue stood on an ornate granite pedestal
The pedestal needs reinforcement to support the heavy sculpture
She put him on a pedestal and ignored his flaws
Heroes often fall from their pedestals when scandals emerge

definitions: person walking along a road or in a developed area
lacking imagination or excitement; dull and ordinary
examples: The pedestrian crossed at the designated crosswalk carefully
Pedestrians have the right of way at intersections
The movie's plot was pedestrian and entirely predictable
His pedestrian taste in art disappointed the critics

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in the care and treatment of infants and children
examples: The pediatrician examined the baby's development at each checkup
Our pediatrician recommended the new vaccination schedule for toddlers

definitions: record of descent of an animal showing it is purebred
person's background or history of achievement lending prestige or distinction
examples: The dog's pedigree traced back five generations of champions
Breeders charge more for puppies with impressive pedigrees
Her academic pedigree included degrees from three Ivy League schools
The candidate's political pedigree impressed the selection committee

definitions: triangular upper part of the front of a classical building, typically surmounting columns
examples: The Greek temple's pediment featured carved mythological scenes
The courthouse pediment bore the scales of justice symbol

definitions: adult who is sexually attracted to children and may act on those impulses
examples: The convicted pedophile was sentenced to twenty years imprisonment
Online safety programs warn children about potential pedophiles
